alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 4:21PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Henderson, northwestern Hancock, south central Henry, southwestern Des Moines, central Lee and east central Clark Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 421 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lowell to near Franklin to near Wayland. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Fort Madison, Keokuk, Carthage, Nauvoo, Hamilton, Warsaw, West Point, Dallas City, Montrose, Wayland, Carman, Alexandria, Ferris, Colusa, Adrian, New Boston, Niota, Iowa Army Ammunition Plant, and Denmark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
